intro: Curculigo ensifolia var. longifolia, commonly known as the long-leaved arrowhead plant, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Hydrangeaceae and is characterized by its distinctive arrow-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, often appearing in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded forest environments. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardeners seeking a unique and exotic foliage plant.
